page.title: 14 An arable Farmer
page.content: Mr.Search chose to be an arable farmer because of the dry climate and heavy moist soils,these are suitable for arable farming.However he used to keep livestock.He owned 350 pigs but the profit was not suitable to keep the farm going.The raw materials were expensive and labour was essential.He owns a small farm or 103 acres off Borwick Lane,Wickford.Three types of crops are grown:rape,wheat and beans. At the moment oil seed rape is grown because it is profitable and in great demand.Wheat is grown because it is a high yeilding and marketable crop. Beans,as like rape are well supported. He does not grow barley as it is not profitable.Rotation is practised on this farm to maintain the condition of the soil.Mr.Search finds that his biggest outlays are machinery,the cost of seed and sprays.
